official-title.#text: To amend title 38, United States Code, to improve the construction of major medical facilities, and for other purposes.

attestation-date.#text: Passed the House of Representatives September 16, 2014.

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the
Congress finds the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: before the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Director of Physical Infrastructure of the General Accountability Office

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: in May 2013, schedule delays of major medical center construction projects of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Veterans’ Affairs of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: have averaged 35 months, with the delays ranging from 14 months to 74 months.

text.#text: According to testimony by the
The average cost increase attributed to such delays has been $336,000,000 per project.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: that is independent of the
because, according to the
, such projects have experienced continuous delays and a total cost increase of nearly $1,000,000,000.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Comptroller General of the United States

text.#text: Management of the major medical facility projects currently underway as of the date of the enactment of this Act in Denver, Colorado, Orlando, Florida, and New Orleans, Louisiana, should be subject to the oversight of a special project manager of the
It is the sense of Congress that—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: has been an abysmal failure; and

text.#text: the management of the major medical center construction projects of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: should fully implement all recommendations made by the
in an April 2013 report to improve construction procedures and practices of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Comptroller General of the United States

text.#text: in order to minimize repeated delays and cost increases to such projects, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

header.#text: Implementation of major medical facility construction reforms

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , the
shall—

text.#text: With respect to each project described in
use the services of a medical equipment planner as part of the architectural and engineering firm for the project;
develop and use a project management plan to ensure clear and consistent communication among all parties;
subject the project to construction peer excellence review;
develop—
a metrics program to enable the monitoring of change-order processing time; and
goals for the change-order process consistent with the best practices of other departments and agencies of the Federal Government; and
to the extent practicable, use design-build processes to minimize multiple change orders.
A project described in this paragraph is a construction or alteration project that is a major medical facility project.

header.#text: Special project manager for certain medical center construction projects

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall enter into an agreement with the
to procure, on a reimbursable basis, the services of the

with respect to appointing not less than one special project manager who has experience in managing construction projects that exceed $60,000,000 to oversee covered projects until the date on which the project is completed.

text.#text: Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: to oversee a covered project shall—

text.#text: A special project manager appointed under
conduct oversight of all construction-related operations at the project, including with respect to—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: involving the prime contractors; and

text.#text: the performance of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: with the Federal Acquisition Regulation, including the VA Acquisition Regulation;

text.#text: the compliance of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: in any construction-related activity at the project, including the approval of change-order requests for the purpose of achieving a timely completion of the project; and

text.#text: advise and assist the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: best construction practices to improve operations for the project.

text.#text: conduct independent technical reviews and recommend to the

and the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: detailed plans of the covered project for which the special project manager is so appointed.

text.#text: Not later than 90 days after being appointed under

and the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: a report detailing the progress of the covered project for which the special project manager is so appointed. Each report shall include—

has not been activated to accept patients as of the date of the enactment of this Act.

No additional funds are authorized to be appropriated to carry out this Act and the amendments made by this Act, and this Act and such amendments shall be carried out using amounts otherwise made available for such purposes.
